info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Mesa County through 700 PM MDT... At 629 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles south of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Mesa County. This includes Colorado 141 between mile markers 129 and 147. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
